Purpose:
Purpose
Determine whether text output from a JavaScript applet is properly
  selected in conjunction with other page content.
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
None.

Steps/Description
View the attached test case. Drag-select from "Browser Javascript Test" to the bottom of the
    document. From the Edit menu, select "Copy". View the resulting clipboard. (e.g. "Show Clipboard" from Finder on
    Mac, or paste into a text editor on Win32/Linux.)

Expected Results
After step #3, the entire content of the page should be copied.
After step #4, the text should be copied reasonably. (use your best
  discretion, or compare to output of IE 5.)

Purpose:
Purpose
This basic testcase is designed to verify that Creating web pages help
  content comes up when clicked, is displayed corectly, and prints
  correctly
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
Netscape should be started and a printer should be installed on the
  machine you are using

Steps/Description
Select the toplevel Help menu. Select Help Contents Click Creating web pages from the left panel Select all contents on right, copy and paste into your favorite
    word processor and run spell check Click the printer icon

Expected Results
3. Creating web pages helpcontent should come up with main topics on
  the left and detailed information on the right
4. There should be no spelling errors (Besides obvious computer terms
  and websites)
5. Creating web pages content should print

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that you can right click an image and save to your local
  drive.
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
Have mozilla started up

Steps/Description
Complete these steps for all images below
Open one of the files listed below Right click the image and select save image Browse to where you want to save on your local disk and save. Open the file in browser (determine the picture has been
    saved)

Expected Results
Image should be saved to local disk.

Purpose:
Purpose
Verify that you can remove a site and username from the passwords never
  saved section of password manager
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an
  account at a site that requires a username and password such as
  http://www.ivillage.com

Steps/Description
Password manager should be enabled, in a different browser create an
    account at a site that requires a username and password such as
    http://www.ivillage.com Go to a site that you have not been to before in Netscape 6, such as
    http://www.ivillage.com Enter your username and password When a dialog appears asking if you would like to save this
    information, click never for this site From the task drop down menu select privacy and security->password
    manager->view stored passwords Click on the passwords never saved tab Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove Click cancel From the task drop down menu select privacy and security->password
    manager->view stored passwords Click the passwords never saved tab Highlight this sight and username in the list and click remove Click ok Click View stored passwords Click Passwords never saved tab

Expected Results
3. Your username and password should be saved to the passwords never saved
  portion of password manager
4. A list of saved passwords should appear
5. The site and username for this site should be listed under the
  passwords never saved tab
6. This site's information should no longer appear in the list
8. A list of saved sites and usernames should appear
9. This site and username should again appear on the list
10. This site and username should no longer appear on the list of never
  saved passwords
13. This site and username should not appear on the passwords never saved
  list.

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that Seamonkey prints CSS2 pages properly
Test steps:
Steps/Description
Run the NIST 
    CSS2 Test Suite Run the NIST 
    CSS1 Tests Run David
    Baron's CSS Tests Run W3C's 
    CSS Tests Suite Run Ian Hickson's Evil
    Test Suite After visiting each test page, print each test (select Print from the
    File menu)

Expected Results
All CSS pages should print as they appear on screen

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that Seamonkey prints Lists properly
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
None

Steps/Description
Launch Apprunner Click here to open a page with different types
    of lists. Select "FILE | PRINT" menu option to print the page.

Expected Results
All lists should print as they appear on the screen.

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that when the mouse is moved over panels, the panels
  highlight
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
This test works only with the "Classic" Theme set for the browser.

Steps/Description
Launch the browser Move the mouse on any of the panels in the Sidebar Each panel should highlight making itself visible when the mouse is
    over it

Expected Results
Panels should highlight when mouse is moved over them

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine the list of available remote panels
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
None.

Steps/Description
Launch the browser From the Sidebar, select "Tabs | Customize Sidebar" From the window that opens up, the pane titled
    "AvailablePanels" should list the following folders by default:
    Favorites, From Netscape, From Others, International. Click and open each folder mentioned above to see that they are
    not empty and that a listing of panels is available in each
    folder Verify that the Favourites folder lists these panels: CNN.com,
    Horoscope, Mozillazine, News, Stocks, Tech News, Weather Verify that the From Netscape folder lists these panels:
    Calender, Horoscopes, Local Events, Local Movies, Local News, News,
    Sports, Stocks, Tech News, Weather Verify that the From Others folder lists these panels:
    BackFlip Buddy, CNET.com, CNN.com, eBay, Kinderview, Mapquest,
    Mozillazine, Red Herring, Webstakes.com and the folder My Netscape
    Network The International folder should list the following folders:
    Brazil, Canada, France, Germany, Japan, Portugal, Spain, Sweden,
    UK

Expected Results
All default remote panels should be available

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that panels can be reordered
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
None.

Steps/Description
Launch the browser From the Sidebar , select "Tabs | Customize Sidebar" From the window that opens up, add a few panels from the left
    pane Highlight on any of the panels in the right pane and click on the
    reorder arrows on the right side Clicking the reorder arrows should move the panel up/down and you
    should be able to place them wherever you want (top to bottom) Clicking "OK" should also reflect the reordering change in the
    Sidebar in the browser window

Expected Results
You should be able to reorder panels as you want

Purpose:
Purpose
Determine that a panel can be added using javascript to the          

  Sidebar
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
None.

Steps/Description
Launch the browser Click here to open a page to add         
    the bugzilla panel to the Sidebar using javascript Click on the link "Add Bugzilla panel to your sidebar" on the page Press "OK" on the confirm dialog Bugzilla panel should get added to the Sidebar at the bottom Click on the panel to open it

Expected Results
Panel should get added by javascript

Purpose:
Purpose
Testing access to the web location dialog
Test steps:
Initial Conditions
The browser should already be open.

Steps/Description
Test the following to see if all of these tasks will bring up the Open
  Web Location dialog:
From the menubar of the browser, select File > Open Web
    Location. Use the keyboard shortcut specific to your platform: Win32 and Unix: Control+Shift+L Macintosh: Command+Shift+L

Expected Results
The Open Web Location should be displayed, regardless of the means you
  used above.
